title: Ryan Reynolds sends naughty tweet after Joker beats Deadpool 2 as top-grossing R-rated film
text:
Joker has become the highest-grossing R-rated movie of all time.

And Ryan Reynolds, star of the previous titleholder Deadpool 2, shared his congratulations on Twitter this Friday with a naughty message.

The 43-year-old Hollywood heartthrob shared a snap from Joker of the title character dancing at the top of a staircase with: 'YOU MOTHER F***ER' written above him.

Out of the running: Ryan Reynolds tweeted his congratulations this Friday to Joker, which has beaten his Deadpool 2 as the top-grossing R-rated film of all time

This charming message was signed off with love from the lead characters of the other nine R-rated movies in the top 10.

Ryan happens to have played the lead characters in both numbers two and three - Deadpool 2 and Deadpool, respectively.

Other characters included Keanu Reeves' Neo from The Matrix Reloaded and Bill Skarsgard's evil clown Pennywise from It.

Number seven was Jim Caviezel's Jesus in The Passion Of The Christ, which is still the top-grossing R-rated film ever at the U.S. domestic box office.

Previous titleholder: Ryan happens to have played the lead characters in both numbers two and three - Deadpool 2 (pictured) and Deadpool, respectively

The man behind the mask: Here Reynolds is seen this week on social media

In order to honor Logan, Ryan did not put the title character's name nor his alias Wolverine but name-checked the actor, fellow Hollywood hunk Hugh Jackman.

Number eight was The Wolfpack - the buddies played by Bradley Cooper, Ed Helms and Zach Galifinakis in The Hangover Part II, from Joker director Todd Phillips.

Jamie Dornan's Mr. Grey in Fifty Shades Of Grey and Seth MacFarlane's title teddy bear in Ted rounded off numbers nine and ten.

Acclaimed performance: Joker stars three-time Oscar nominee Joaquin Phoenix in the origin story of the title Batman villain with a supporting performance by Robert De Niro

'R-Rated box office congratulatory posts aren’t like the ones you’re used to...' wrote Ryan in the tweet accompanying the meme.

Joker stars three-time Oscar nominee Joaquin Phoenix in the origin story of the title Batman villain with a supporting performance by Robert De Niro.

The movie became an instant box office smash amid mixed reviews that have left it with a 69% rating on Rotten Tomatoes.
description: Joker has become the highest-grossing R-rated movie of all time. And Ryan Reynolds, star of the previous titleholder Deadpool 2, shared his congratulations on Twitter this Friday.
